reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Muerte a los Kobolts
reviews.reviewText: Estuvo bueno, aquí termina lo mostrado en el anime por fin, de ahora en adelante vamos a experimentar nuevas cosas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A very different kind of Isekai
reviews.reviewText: I'm now up to volume 11 of this series, and I'm a little torn between how to rate this. The first two volumes in the series and the story told between them is great. Later ones are up and down, mostly down.That said, what makes this series stand apart from other isekais is that it treats the battles as more realistic, with the main cast of characters not being overpowered -- even being underpowered compared to both the hostile creatures they come into contact with and their fellow "volunteer soldiers." I think that gives the fights a bit more weight, and the stakes feel a bit higher than in a series like SAO or Danmachi. I'd say the overall atmosphere is pretty dour on account of that, though it's not without a few touches of comic relief.The characters feel very well fleshed out here, although your mileage may vary in later volumes as to whether they get more flanderized or don't develop enough.Anyway, I feel pretty good about recommending the first two volumes for this series, at least. The anime was also done pretty well, and its first season ends at the same place as this volume.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pg-13 not for young children
reviews.reviewText: Anime was pg and even though only one season, my son (8) loved it. Saw that there was novelization of the series and bought some of the books, the first three. The books are most definitely pg13 and there was no kind of warning. Have had to skip over or summarize a few parts and not even a quarter of the way into the first book. Still a good series and I enjoy it enough that I'm still reading them to him.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Best: Grimgar? More please!
reviews.reviewText: This series continues to impress me. It's fantastical, but real, a bit gritty, and feels authentic. The character's consciences (about killing other sentient beings even if they are "monsters") and emotions feel genuine. Maybe it's because I am of a similar age and have similar pesonal experiences that the author describes in their afterword, but the story and how it is told really resonates with me. I love how the characters are developing, and I like the direction the story is taking. I truly enjoy this series so far, far more than any other Light Novel series I have read previously. Thank you for writing this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Party coming together
reviews.reviewText: After the events wrapping up nicely in volume 1, it's time to see some character growth in the party members. Haruhiro and friends find some new stomping grounds and with it, new adventures and hardships. The second volume gets to focus more on the new priest Merry and more details regarding her background.I feel that this novel had some good fight sequences, character development and strengthening of our favorite underdog party in Grimar. Some of te illustrations here were very well done and contributed greatly to the feel of the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I had seen the anime, and wanted to see how the light novel was different. It doesn't disrupt my pleasure in the anime, but it definitely deepens my enjoyment of the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book is where the film adaption ends.
reviews.reviewText: If you watched the film adaption of this light novel. You'll know that somewhere in these pages the book surpasses the film in terms of story progression. Ive watched the anime and it abruptly ended and never got signed on for a second season so I've been dying to find out what happens which is why I resorted to reading the light novel. It didn't disappoint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really fun series.
reviews.reviewText: Really enjoy this series. Started with the anime and liked is so much that the light novels were just as good. I am a sucker for a well told 'gamers/players get transported to a fantasy realm' type store and this fits the bill. Grimgar specializes in taking a very reasonable approach to what is happening. We don't follow the savants, we follow the average, every day people who struggle and do what they can to understand each other and get through each day.
Definitivamente continuo interesado en la novela. Sería increíble que continuará el manga y anime. Recomiendo la novela. Seguiré con el próximo tomo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 12, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I've been trying to get a copy of this volume for a while. The book arrived safely and is in great condition.

Was a great addition to volume 1, expanding on the characters and resolving the second storyline the author initiated in the first book. This leaves volume 3 open to wherever the author wants to take it, which I look forward to reading
